name: Basic HTML Website
description: A simple HTML website with CSS and JavaScript for static web development

files.content:
{{project_name}}

  • Home
  • About
  • Contact

Welcome to {{project_name}}

{{project_description}}

About

This is a basic HTML website template created with SAgile IDE.

Responsive Design

Mobile-friendly layout that works on all devices.

Clean Code

Well-structured HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Easy to Customize

Simple structure that's easy to modify and extend.

Contact

© 2024 {{project_name}}. Created with SAgile IDE.

# {{project_name}}

{{project_description}}

## Features

- ✅ Responsive HTML5 structure
- ✅ Modern CSS3 styling with Flexbox and Grid
- ✅ Interactive JavaScript functionality
- ✅ Smooth scrolling navigation
- ✅ Contact form with validation
- ✅ Fade-in animations
- ✅ Mobile-friendly design
- ✅ Cross-browser compatibility

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- A modern web browser
- A text editor or IDE
- Optional: Local web server for development

### Installation

1. Clone or download this repository
2. Open `index.html` in your web browser
3. Start customizing!

### Development

For the best development experience, use a local web server:

#### Using Python
```bash
# Python 3
python -m http.server 8000

# Python 2
python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000
```

#### Using Node.js
```bash
npx http-server
```

#### Using PHP
```bash
php -S localhost:8000
```

Then open `http://localhost:8000` in your browser.

## Project Structure

```
├── index.html           # Main HTML file
├── styles/
│   └── main.css        # Main stylesheet
├── scripts/
│   └── main.js         # Main JavaScript file
└── README.md           # This file
```

## Customization

### Colors

The main color scheme is defined in CSS custom properties. You can easily change the theme by modifying these values in `styles/main.css`:

```css
:root {
    --primary-color: #667eea;
    --secondary-color: #764ba2;
    --accent-color: #ffd700;
    --text-color: #333;
    --background-color: #f4f4f4;
}
```

### Content

1. **Navigation**: Edit the navigation links in the `<nav>` section of `index.html`
2. **Hero Section**: Update the main heading and description
3. **About Section**: Customize the features and content
4. **Contact Form**: Modify form fields as needed
5. **Footer**: Update copyright and links

### Styling

- **Typography**: Change fonts by updating the `font-family` in `styles/main.css`
- **Layout**: Modify the CSS Grid and Flexbox layouts
- **Animations**: Customize the fade-in effects and transitions
- **Responsive**: Adjust breakpoints in the media queries

### JavaScript Functionality

- **Navigation**: Smooth scrolling between sections
- **Form Validation**: Client-side form validation
- **Animations**: Intersection Observer for scroll animations
- **Notifications**: Custom notification system

## Browser Support

- Chrome (latest)
- Firefox (latest)
- Safari (latest)
- Edge (latest)
- Internet Explorer 11+ (with some limitations)

## Performance Tips

1. **Images**: Optimize images before adding them
2. **CSS**: Minify CSS for production
3. **JavaScript**: Minify JavaScript for production
4. **Fonts**: Use web fonts efficiently
5. **Caching**: Implement proper caching headers

## SEO Optimization

To improve SEO:

1. Add meta descriptions
2. Include Open Graph tags
3. Use semantic HTML elements
4. Add alt text to images
5. Implement structured data

```html
<!-- Add to <head> section -->
<meta name="description" content="Your page description here">
<meta property="og:title" content="{{project_name}}">
<meta property="og:description" content="{{project_description}}">
<meta property="og:image" content="path/to/image.jpg">
```

## Deployment

### GitHub Pages
1. Push your code to a GitHub repository
2. Go to Settings > Pages
3. Select source branch (usually `main`)
4. Your site will be available at `https://username.github.io/repository-name`

### Netlify
1. Connect your repository to Netlify
2. Set build command (if needed)
3. Deploy automatically on push

### Traditional Web Hosting
1. Upload all files to your web server
2. Ensure `index.html` is in the root directory
3. Configure your domain

## Contributing

1. Fork the project
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`)
5. Open a Pull Request
